segment.source: Learn how to schedule a one-time background task, or run a periodic background task.
segment.target: Learn how to schedule a one-time background task, or run a periodic background task.

segment.source: This example assumes that you have a background task that needs to run periodically, or at a specific time, to support your app.
segment.target: This example assumes that you have a background task that needs to run periodically, or at a specific time, to support your app.

segment.source: A background task will only run using a TimeTrigger if you have called RequestAccessAsync.
segment.target: A background task will only run using a TimeTrigger if you have called RequestAccessAsync.

segment.source: This topic assumes you have already created a background task class, including the Run method that is used as the background task entry point.
segment.target: This topic assumes you have already created a background task class, including the Run method that is used as the background task entry point.

segment.source: The second parameter, OneShot, specifies whether the background task will run once or keep running periodically.
segment.target: The second parameter, OneShot, specifies whether the background task will run once or keep running periodically.

segment.source: If OneShot is set to true, the first parameter (FreshnessTime) specifies the number of minutes to wait before scheduling the background task.
segment.target: If OneShot is set to true, the first parameter (FreshnessTime) specifies the number of minutes to wait before scheduling the background task.

segment.source: If OneShot is set to false, FreshnessTime specifies the frequency by which the background task will run.
segment.target: If OneShot is set to false, FreshnessTime specifies the frequency by which the background task will run.

segment.source: The built-in timer for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps runs background tasks in 15-minute intervals.
segment.target: The built-in timer for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps runs background tasks in 15-minute intervals.

segment.source: If FreshnessTime is set to 15 minutes and OneShot is true, the task will run once starting between 0 and 15 minutes from the time it is registered.
segment.target: If FreshnessTime is set to 15 minutes and OneShot is true, the task will run once starting between 0 and 15 minutes from the time it is registered.

segment.source: If FreshnessTime is set to 15 minutes and OneShot is false, the task will run every 15 minutes starting between 0 and 15 minutes from the time it is registered.
segment.target: If FreshnessTime is set to 15 minutes and OneShot is false, the task will run every 15 minutes starting between 0 and 15 minutes from the time it is registered.

segment.source: Note If FreshnessTime is set to less than 15 minutes, an exception is thrown when attempting to register the background task.
segment.target: Note If FreshnessTime is set to less than 15 minutes, an exception is thrown when attempting to register the background task.

segment.source: (Optional) Add a condition
segment.target: (Optional) Add a condition

segment.source: If necessary, create a background task condition to control when the task runs.
segment.target: If necessary, create a background task condition to control when the task runs.

segment.source: A condition prevents the background task from running until the condition is met - for more information, see Set conditions for running a background task.
segment.target: A condition prevents the background task from running until the condition is met - for more information, see Set conditions for running a background task.

segment.source: In this example the condition is set to UserPresent so that, once triggered, the task only runs once the user is active.
segment.target: In this example the condition is set to UserPresent so that, once triggered, the task only runs once the user is active.

segment.source: For a list of possible conditions, see SystemConditionType.
segment.target: For a list of possible conditions, see SystemConditionType.
